page.title: 12THE BRENTWOOD GAZETTE
page.content: The Brentwood Gazette is printed at Westway in Chelmsford. Local reporters collect information from Brentwood and it is edited at the main office. Unlike the large national papers in Fleet Street, this paper is put together with the aid of a computer, needing fewer workers, thus saving money in production. The information is typed onto a disc and stored until needed. The layout of the paper is computer controlled. The print is transferred onto large metal plates and when the paper goes to press, a large complicated machine prints, sorts and cuts the pages. A conveyor belt takes the finished product to be packed and despatched. The National Newspapers still use type set which takes far longer to arrange.
